current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To provide for the introduction of pay-for-performance compensation mechanisms into contracts of the Department of Veterans Affairs with community-based outpatient clinics for the provision of health care services, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text: Veterans Health Care Improvement Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
Veterans of the Armed Forces have made tremendous sacrifices in the defense of freedom and liberty.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: recognizes these great sacrifices and reaffirms America’s strong commitment to its veterans.
has dramatically increased funding for the
for veterans health care in the years since September 11, 2001.

text.#text: As part of the on-going congressional effort to recognize the sacrifices made by America’s veterans,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for veterans health care is allocated toward community-based outpatient clinics (CBOCs).

text.#text: Part of the funding for the
A number of CBOCs are administered by private contractors.
CBOCs administered by private contractors operate on a capitated basis.
Some current contracts for CBOCs may create an incentive for contractors to enroll as many veterans as possible, without ensuring timely access to high quality health care for such veterans.
The top priorities for CBOCs should be to provide quality health care and patient satisfaction for America’s veterans.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: currently tracks the quality of patient care through its Computerized Patient Record System. However, fees paid to contractors are not currently adjusted automatically to reflect the quality of care provided to patients.

text.#text: The
A pay-for-performance payment model offers a promising approach to health care delivery by aligning the payment of fees to contractors with the achievement of better health outcomes for patients.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: should begin to emphasize pay-for-performance in its contracts with CBOCs.

text.#text: The

header.#text: Pay-for-performance under Department of Veterans Affairs contracts with community-based outpatient health care clinics

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a plan to introduce pay-for-performance measures into contracts which compensate contractors of the
for the provision of health care services through community-based outpatient clinics (CBOCs).

text.#text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Veterans Health Care Improvement Act of 2013/s:3/ss:a

text.#text: The plan required by

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for the provision of health care services through CBOCs begin to utilize pay-for-performance compensation mechanisms for compensating contractors for the provision of such services through such clinics, including mechanisms as follows:

text.#text: Measures to ensure that contracts of the
To provide incentives for clinics that provide high-quality health care.
To provide incentives to better assure patient satisfaction.
To impose penalties (including termination of contract) for clinics that provide substandard care.
Mechanisms to collect and evaluate data on the outcomes of the services generally provided by CBOCs in order to provide for an assessment of the quality of health care provided by such clinics.
Mechanisms to eliminate abuses in the provision of health care services by CBOCs under contracts that continue to utilize capitated-basis compensation mechanisms for compensating contractors.
Mechanisms to ensure that veterans are not denied care or face undue delays in receiving care.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall commence the implementation of the plan on the date that is 60 days after the date of the submittal of the plan. In implementing the plan, the
may initially carry out one or more pilot programs to assess the feasibility and advisability of mechanisms under the plan.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report setting forth the recommendations of the
as to the feasibility and advisability of utilizing pay-for-performance compensation mechanisms in the provision of health care services by the
by means in addition to CBOCs.

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act and every 180 days thereafter, the
